name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In the past two days, there have been many crowd demonstrations against Yoon Seok-yeol on the streets of Seoul.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Lee Jae-myung, a member of the National Assembly and representative of the opposition Democratic Party of Korea, was giving a speech. He said, "We must hold our seats in the National Assembly until the president announces the lifting of martial law."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: At this moment, people in South Korea are calling for the imprisonment of South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: People outside the building cheered. The president's power was at this moment limited by the legal framework.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Despite the soldiers' obstruction, all the congressmen climbed over the wall and entered the Congress. After entering the Congress, they quickly set up roadblocks and quickly voted to pass a plenary meeting to lift martial law.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung announced that Yoon Seok-yeol is no longer fit to serve as South Korean president and called on supporters to come to the parliament to protest.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Minutes earlier, soldiers broke into the Capitol through a window

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Seoul citizens photographed armored vehicles driving on the road

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: During the dispute, the soldier pointed a gun at the Democratic Party spokesperson An Guiling

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Due to the emergency martial law, all entertainment activities in South Korea were cancelled and patrolling police could be seen everywhere on the streets.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung announced that Yoon Seok-yeol is no longer fit to serve as South Korean president and called on supporters to come to parliament to protest.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: South Korea's parliament will try to lift the president's martial law order, but the military may try to arrest lawmakers. Lee Jae-myung, leader of South Korea's largest opposition party, said that parliament will try to lift South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol's martial law order, but the military may try to arrest lawmakers.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: South Korea's National Assembly passed a resolution to lift martial law. South Korea's National Assembly held an emergency plenary session in the early morning of the 4th to vote on the "lifting of martial law". 190 members attended the meeting and voted in favor. South Korea's National Assembly Speaker Woo Won-sik then announced that the emergency martial law order was invalid.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In front of the Congress, people chanted, "Lift martial law! Overthrow the dictatorship!"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: The Korean movie "Seoul Spring" topped the Weibo entertainment hot search list.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: The martial law troops that entered the Capitol began to withdraw.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: South Korea's parliament voted 190-0 to lift martial law... South Korean soldiers began to leave the parliament, and protesters cheered.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the evening of December 3, as President Yoon Seok-yeol announced the emergency martial law, soldiers from the Capital Defense Command took a bus to the main gate of the National Assembly. Just as they were about to enter, they were stopped by the citizens of Seoul. The citizens' delay also successfully helped all the members of the National Assembly to climb over the wall and enter the National Assembly in time for the plenary session.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Lawmakers said they would remain in Congress until the president lifted martial law.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: At present, several armored vehicles of the South Korean military were driving towards the National Assembly Building in Yeongdeungpo District, Seoul, South Korea, but were blocked by the public. Then, the military armored vehicles, escorted by several South Korean police officers, drove away from the protesting and obstructing crowd and drove towards the South Korean National Assembly Building.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Seoul residents stopped an armored vehicle on the street as it pretended to leave and then tried to turn around and return to the National Assembly

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Former South Korean President Moon Jae-in wrote: As the former commander-in-chief of the military, I have the following requirements for the military. The military must never make the same mistake against the people again. The military must not support unconstitutional coup propaganda. In particular, the military must not hinder the activities of the National Assembly and members of the National Assembly who have the constitutional power to demand the dissolution of martial law. The military should faithfully perform its duties at its post. The current task is to prevent the security crisis that may be caused by unconstitutional coup propaganda.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: South Korea's National Assembly prepares to impeach Yoon Seok-yeol About 40 South Korean lawmakers plan to introduce a bill to impeach President Yoon Seok-yeol on Wednesday, according to Yonhap News Agency. Other lawmakers, including some in leadership positions, have reportedly called on Yoon to resign immediately ahead of any impeachment proceedings.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: According to Yonhap News Agency, South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol said that he would lift the martial law order after lawmakers voted down his order, but it was early in the morning and he could not lift the order immediately. He had to wait for the cabinet to reach the minimum attendance number before lifting it. Shortly afterwards, the cabinet voted to lift the martial law. Before the cabinet reached the designated attendance number to lift the martial law order, President Yoon issued a statement on the lifting of martial law: "Dear citizens:

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: According to the BBC, the military has withdrawn from the South Korean National Assembly and officials have removed furniture barricades in front of the parliament building after South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol announced the lifting of martial law.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: BBC reports US State Department officials were caught off guard by President Yoon Seok-yeol's sudden declaration of martial law. The alliance between Washington and Seoul is crucial, with the US having nearly 30,000 troops in South Korea protecting it from its nuclear-armed northern neighbour. The State Department said Seoul's leadership took the drastic step without informing Washington in advance, an extremely rare move. The US said it had not been notified in advance of any martial law declaration.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: South Korea's largest union calls on its one million members to strike until President Yoon resigns BBC report The Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU), one of South Korea's largest labor unions, has called on its members to strike until President Yoon Seok-yeol resigns. In a post on Facebook, the union called Yoon's brief martial law declaration a crime of rebellion and called on its more than one million members to rally in Seoul and other areas on Wednesday morning to oppose the move.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: North Korea may take advantage of the political instability caused by the martial law declaration Daniel Russell, former US Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs, told the BBC that North Korea is likely to take advantage of the political instability caused by President Yoon Seok-yeol's surprise declaration of martial law. Yoon initially claimed that the move was to protect the country from North Korean communist forces and eliminate "anti-national elements." Russell said this claim was "quite far-fetched."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung live-streamed a video of himself climbing over the wall to vote in the National Assembly during martial law

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol's decision to introduce martial law has been strongly criticized by leaders of his own party. "As the ruling party, we deeply regret to the public," said Han Dong-hoon, leader of the People's Power Party, in a statement to reporters early Wednesday morning.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: This morning, a large number of South Koreans gathered outside the National Assembly to protest, and the protesters shouted: "Arrest Yoon Seok-yeol!"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
South Korea's military said martial law will remain in effect until the president announces otherwise or officially lifts it.
The South Korean presidential office is discussing whether it can exercise its right to refuse to lift martial law

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Easley, a professor of international studies at Ewha Womans University in Seoul, analyzed that President Yoon's martial law declaration was "a legal overreach and a political miscalculation."
Easley further pointed out: "This may be more harmful to South Korea's domestic politics and international reputation than the destruction of the U.S. Capitol by rioters on January 6, 2021." At that time, rioters broke through barriers and ransacked the U.S. Capitol with the intention of preventing the certification of Joe Biden's presidential election.
Easley's evaluation of Yoon Seok-yeol is: "With extremely low public support and no strong support within his own party and government, the president should have known how difficult it would be to implement his late-night decree." He described Yoon Seok-yeol: "He looks like a besieged politician who made a desperate move to fight against the growing scandals, institutional obstruction and calls for impeachment, which may be exacerbated by this."
"North Korea may take a wait-and-see approach, but it cannot be ruled out...
fullContent:
首尔梨花女子大学国际研究教授伊斯利分析，尹总统的戒严令声明是“法律上的过度行为和政治上的误判”。
伊斯利进一步指出：“对于韩国的国内政治和国际声誉而言，这可能比2021年1月6日美国国会大厦遭到暴乱者破坏更为有害。”当时，暴乱者冲破屏障，洗劫了美国国会大厦，意图阻止乔·拜登总统选举的认证。
伊斯利对尹锡悦的评价是：“在公众支持极低且在自己的政党和政府内部也没有强大支持的情况下，总统本应知道要实施他深夜的法令有多困难。”他描述尹锡悦：“他看起来像是一个被围困的政治人物，为了对抗不断增加的丑闻、机构阻挠和弹劾呼声，做出了绝望的举动，这些都可能会因此而加剧。”
“北韩可能会采取观望态度，但也不能排除平壤会试图利用首尔的分歧。”

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Last night, South Koreans tried to stop the military from climbing over the wall and entering the parliament.
This morning, police stopped protesters on the main road.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
South Korea's ruling party is discussing expelling President Yoon Seok-yeol from the party and demanding the resignation of all cabinet members who failed to prevent martial law
BBC reports President Yoon's People's Power Party is holding an emergency meeting to discuss the next steps after last night's chaos. The closed-door meeting began at 7 a.m. local time and was chaired by party leader Han Dong-hoon. The majority of the party's Supreme Council has agreed to ask Yoon Seok-yeol to leave the party to "protect the spirit of the constitution."
The meeting also unanimously demanded the resignation of all State Council members who failed to prevent martial law, as well as the dismissal of Defense Minister Kim Young-hyun, who proposed the idea of martial law.
